Title: CDL Terminology for the ESL Learner
Description: Do you want to get your Commercial Drivers License (CDL) but you're not comfortable with all of the english CDL terms?  This class is for you.  This class will get you comfortable with the technical language used in the CDL world to ensure you know all the necessary terms to pass your CDL test.
Target Audience: General Public, Current Students, Alumni, Faculty & Staff, Prospective Students

Title: Celebrate Your Name
Description:
Have you ever wondered what your name means? Come find out at the Celebrate Your Name Event. Once you’ve answered your question, you can make a beautiful piece of art that shows who you are.  Free lunch included.
Sponsored by the Campus Activities Programming Board of Aims Community College. This program is funded by student fees and is provided for the students of Aims Community College. Call 970-339-6225 or email student.activities@aims.edu for more information.  
Call 970-339-6388 to request accommodations for this event. The views presented at this program do not necessarily represent those of Aims Community College or the Associated Students of Aims.
Target Audience: Current Students

Title: Compassion Fatigue
Description:
Compassion Fatigue training seeks to educate participants on the natures of Burnout and Compassion
Fatigue, provide clarification through lively discussion, engaging activities, and self-assessment, and
incorporate coping strategies and techniques for adjustment whether personal or work-related. Many
have found this training to be valuable to their longevity in chosen professions and have applied
associated tools throughout their continued work and personal relationships and environments.
Additional Information:
Burnout is associated with stress and hassles involved in your work; it is very cumulative, is relatively predictable and frequently a vacation or change of job helps a great deal.  Compassion Fatigue is a state of tension and preoccupation with the individual or cumulative trauma of clients as manifested in one or more ways including re-experiencing the traumatic event, avoidance/numbing or reminder of the event and persistent arousal.  You are absorbing the trauma through the eyes and ears of your clients. It can be thought of as secondary post-traumatic stress.
Target Audience: General Public, Current Students, Alumni, Faculty & Staff, Prospective Students

Title: Donor/Scholar Reception

Title: Drum Circle
Description:
Enjoy a summer evening outdoors with your fellow community members for a drum circle! Join us for a relaxing and uplifting experience led by Aims President and CEO Dr. Leah L. Bornstein:

June 20 - Summer Solstice
July 20 - New Moon

Be sure to bring your own blanket/seat and your own style of drum: indigenous, wooden blocks, shakers or any other percussion instrument. All types are welcome! This event is free and open to 
the public, ages 12-112!

Please note that social distancing will be strictly enforced. Groups must sit 6 feet apart and masks must be worn.

This will take place on the grass area outside of our Cornerstone Building located off of 20th Street and 54th Avenue.
Target Audience: General Public, Current Students, Alumni, Faculty & Staff, Prospective Students

Title: Figure Drawing
Description: This workshop will focus on a variety of strategies (such as gestural and subtractive) to approach drawing the figure. Some anatomy and proportional instruction will aid you in striving to capture the exact structure of the nude models (male and female) in three separate sessions. You will use the basic drawing media of pencil, charcoal, and pastels on 18 x 24 drawing paper as well as Canson “Mi Tientes” medium value paper. You will be provided a supply list to purchase on your own.  This workshop is intended for any level of experience. Age requirement: 18 years old.  Please bring your own lunch.
Target Audience: General Public, Current Students, Alumni, Faculty & Staff, Prospective Students

Title: Pharmacy Technician
Description: The need for Pharmacy Technicians continues to grow with demand expected to increase substantially through 2020. Aims is offering a new, non-credit Pharmacy Technician program where you will learn to be responsible for assembling medicines for prescriptions and providing information to patients and healthcare professionals. This program will prepare you to enter the pharmacy field and to pursue certification including the Pharmacy Technician Certification Board's PTCB exam.
Target Audience: General Public, Current Students, Alumni, Faculty & Staff, Prospective Students

Title: Reductive Landscape Painting in the studio
Description: This workshop will focus on following a subtractive process in the completion of a 16 x 20 landscape painting from a photographic reference. Spatial perspective attributes and how they impact a landscape, compositional and design elements, value studies, the subtractive method, and premixing your palette will be discussed in a classroom. You will complete several small practice oil sketches prior to beginning the final studio piece. You will be provided a supply list to purchase on your own including canvases or panels. You will need to come to the workshop with 10 8”x10” full color photos of landscapes and references to possible paintings. (The images should NOT be on your electronic devices but on actual photo paper for one of the activities in the session). Age requirement: 18 years old.
Target Audience: General Public, Current Students, Alumni, Faculty & Staff, Prospective Students

Title: Reductive Landscape Painting in the studio
Description: This workshop will focus on following a subtractive process in the completion of a 16 x 20 landscape painting from a photographic reference. Title: Tai Chi Chih
Description: Tai Chi Chih is a gently moving meditation that consists of 19 slow movements and one pose.   These movements create balance, peace and circulates the natural energy, or "Chi"of the body . They increase relaxation and reduce stress while enhancing balance, energy, stamina, and flexibility.  Join us for this gentle practice and receive the amazing benefits Tai Chi Chih has to offer.
Target Audience: General Public, Current Students, Alumni, Faculty & Staff, Prospective Students
